synopsis.p: Tests an assertion on specified elements.

description.p: evaluates as a list of elements. Then, for each element, evaluates as a boolean. reports each element for which is false. aborts the processing of the corpus if is true.

param-doc.name: target
param-doc.p: Expression evaluated as a list of elements with the corpus as the context element. This parameter specifies the elements on which the assertion is checked.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: An expression evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as the context element. This module processes the corpus if the result is true

param-doc.name: assertion
param-doc.p: Expression evaluated as a boolean with the target element as the context element. This parameter specifies the assertion to be checked on each target.

param-doc.name: stopAt
param-doc.p: Maximum number of assertion failures before will stop checking.

param-doc.name: severe
param-doc.p: If true and there is at least one assertion failure, then will abort the processing of the corpus.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.

param-doc.name: message
param-doc.p: Customize the assertion failure message. This expression is evaluated as a string from the failed target.

param-doc.name: outFile
param-doc.p: Path to the file where to record assertion failures. If not set then assertion failures are not recorded, and only displayed on the log.
